title: Beset by political dysfunction and chronic economic crisis, the EU is too dangerous to remain inside
text:
Since June 2016, the EU has been consistently portrayed as an all-conquering superpower, set against a flailing UK. The mainstream media narrative has been to contrast the EU’s unalloyed success and rosy economic prospects, alongside Britain’s inevitable post-Brexit demise. The EU27 is disciplined, its lock-step unity over Brexit contrasting with our parliamentary shambles. Continental Europe is deemed the only place to trade – attempts to broaden our commercial focus, developing deeper links elsewhere, are dubbed “economic self-harm”.
